definition: selected outstanding scholars (in former times)/cream of the crop
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: The imperial examination system in the Tang Dynasty left a cross-age impact on the intellectual selection in China.
sentences.chinese: 唐代科举制度在中国选士制度史上有着划时代的意义。

sentences.english: The System of Selecting Officials by the Evaluation of the Candidates' Poems or Rhyming Proses was very special in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 诗赋取士制度是我国古代一种非常有特色的选士制度。

definition: imperial exam involving writing essay on policy 策論|策论[ce4 lun4]
successful military candidate in the imperial provincial examination
xiaolian, two examination subjects in Han, later a single subject in Ming and Qing/successful second degree candidate
essay on policy in question and answer form used in imperial exams
to propose (for a job)/to nominate/to recommend
Imperial College of Supreme Learning, established in 124 BC, and the highest educational institute in ancient China until the Sui Dynasty
scholar preparing for imperial examinations (in former times)
